Name: Linda Williams
Description:
Linda was stabbed by 15-year-old Ron Johnson.

> A Yonkers youth pleaded guilty Monday to the murder of a transsexual lover with whom he had gotten into an argument.
>
> Ronald Johnson, 17, pleaded guilty to first-degree manslaughter in the stabbing death of 33-year-old Linda Williams, the former [deadname] Williams.
>
> Johnson, who was 15 when the slaying occured, has been declared a juvenile offender. Westchester County Court Judge Carmine C. Marasco said Monday he would sentence him to a term of three to nine years in a youth facility.
>
> The maximum sentence Johnson could have received as a juvenile offender was 10 years. As an adult, he could have been given up to 25 years in prison.
>
> Sentencing was scheduled for April 26. -Eric Nagourney

Source: United Press International, April 1, 1985

Name: Tara O'Hara
Description:
Tara was a drag queen. Sometime in 1983 (we don't know the date) she was found severely beaten in a ladies’ room in Tiergarten and taken to hospital, lying in a coma for weeks until the doctors pulled the plug.

> Her male persona was raised by a Jehovah's Witness family in New Orleans. In the early 80s, he was working in Berlin as an English teacher.
> 
> When he discovered Romy Haag's drag club he came back again and again, and started wearing drag to the club. This lead to a part in the show and he gave up both teaching and the Jehovah's Witnesses.
> 
> She was in Rosa von Praunheim's 1983 film, Stadt Der Verlorenen Seelen (City of Lost Souls) along with Jayne County and Angie Stardust where they all play versions of themselves. Tara was murdered in 1983.
